titleStmt.title: To MARGUERITE POWER,Marguerite Agnes Power (?1815-67; Dictionary of National Biography), novelist; contributor of prose and poetry to Household Words and All the Year Round. CD met her through her aunt, the Countess of Blessington (1789-1849). In 1857 CD, Thackeray, and John Forster raised a subscription of £200 for her; see To Thackeray, 4 Dec 1857, Pilgrim Letters 8, p. 486. 19 JUNE 1866
titleStmt.bibl: Charles Dickens Letters Project, ed. Leon Litvack, Katie Brandt, Emily Bell, and Jeremy Parrott (London: Dickens Fellowship), DickensLetters.com.

sourceDesc.p: Text from facsimile in University Archives online catalogue, November 2017.

address.addrLine: Miss Power | 26 Edmund Terrace | Notting Hill | London W.

dateline.placeName:
GAD’S HILL PLACE
HIGHAM BY ROCHESTER, KENT.

body.p: I am extremely pleased with the Vine,Thus in MS. Power was the author of the poem 'The Vines', All the Year Round 15 (7 July 1866): 609-10. as a charming and elegant little poem – in which I assuredly see no trace of the difficulty you speak of.Possibly Power’s failing health; she suffered a spinal injury after a fall from a horse, and died after a long battle with cancer. See To Mrs Henderson, 4 July 1867, Pilgrim Letters 11, p. 390. To the best of my belief it comes in innumerable cases – and (happily) goes.

Rest satisfied that I will gently explain exactly what you write on the other point, in the two quarters to which I have natural and easy access. Untraced I should have sent you this note sooner, but for having been away on a rest-trip after hard work.
